application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: 1 x Oak (applicants ref. T11) - Reduce into a more compact shape to encourage regeneration, sections of approx 2-3m from branch tips to be removed. Remove all large diameter dead branches. 1 x Oak (applicants ref. T12) - Thin by 10% and remove all large diameter dead branches. Investigate historic snapped out limb on the Southern side and reduce end weight as required to make safe. 1 x Oak (applicants ref. T13) - Thin by 10% and remove all large diameter dead branches.1 x Oak (applicants ref. T14) - Thin out the main framework by 10% and remove all large diameter dead branches.1 x Oak (applicants ref. T15) - Thin the canopy by 10% and a lift of lower trunk epicormic growth. Remove all large diameter dead branches.1 x Oak (applicants ref. T16) - Selectively reduce and shape the upper canopy to a more balanced shape by 2-3m from branch tips, thin by 10% and remove all large diameter dead branches.2 x Hornbeam (applicants ref. T17, T24) - Reduce the canopy by 3-4m from branch tips to lessen end weight and canopy wind sail area.1 x Hornbeam (applicants ref. (applicants ref. T19) - Thin out the canopy by 20% to let more light through and remove  dead branches.1 x Hornbeam (applicants ref. T20) - Lightly reshape the canopy by reducing overlong shoots back into the main canopy outline, up to 2m from branch tips and remove all large diameter dead branches.1 x Oak (applicants ref. T21) - Thin out the canopy by 10% and remove dead branches.2 x Hornbeam (applicants ref. T22, T23) - Thin out the canopy by 20% and remove all large diameter dead branches.1 x Hornbeam (applicants ref. T25) - Remove Eastern lateral growing into T26 to separate the two trees and let more light through to the lawn area. Thin the rest of the canopy out by 10%.1 x Hornbeam (applicants ref. T26) - Thin out the canopy by 10% and remove dead branches.1 x Hornbeam (applicants ref. T27) - Thin out the canopy by 20% and remove dead branches.
